Not “one” best president, three, each having the judgement, courage, perseverance, and greatness, to save our great country. Who do you think they are? Correct! Abe Lincoln, Franklin Roosevelt, and John Kennedy. Abe Lincoln did the impossible, he kept the country together while going through a multilevel political and personal nightmare. No easy job bringing the South back into the Union, without grinding them into the dirt: he made sure that they came back as equals, not a defeated country. FDR: He did everything he could to get America into WWII, and was successful before it was too late, an almost impossible feat considering how public opinion was so against another war, and considering the powerful “America First” (hmm, that sound familiar?) groups that hated the concept that America would become “globalist” if we entered the conflict. If we did not get into the war, Germany most certainly would have built the first atomic weapon, and the world would not be what you see today. JFK: his perfect analysis of the Cuban Missile Crisis, and his decisions which resulted, averting WWIII.
